sentence: Brand elements aim to enhance brand awareness and facilitate a strong, favorable, and ___ brand image.
Memorability, meaningfulness, and ___ are key criteria for choosing effective brand elements.
Brand names often capture the ___ theme of a product.
Leveraging secondary associations involves linking the brand to entities like ___ or people.
High levels of fit in brand extensions facilitate ___ of brand knowledge.
Brand equity can be measured using a price ___ approach.
___ branding strategy focuses on the individual product, not the company.
In a ___ branding strategy, all products share the same company name.
Strong brands allow for ___ brand extensions across product categories.
The brand architecture defines the ___ and interrelationships of brands.
The transfer process underlies the logic of brand ___ .
___ refers to the coherence of brand-specific meanings in extensions.
Brands with broad associative networks show high ___ .
Good brand names should be meaningful, ___ , and unique.
Protectability is a criterion used when selecting ___ elements.
___ strategies manage the strength of spillover effects between brands.
One advantage of single branding is reduced risk of negative ___ .
The Van Westendorp method is used to determine ___ sensitivity.
___ elements like jingles and characters help identify the brand.
Successful brand ___ requires consistency in strategy and messaging.
